Aromas of stewed prunes, blue flowers and exotic spices lead the way along with whiffs of underbrush. The full-bodied palate doles out baked plum, steeped cherry, licorice and mocha before a sage finish. Close-grained tannins lend firm support. Drink 2022–2036. KERIN O’KEEFE

Fragrant and racy, this elegant, focused white opens with heady scents of yellow stone fruit, spring blossom and wild herb. The vibrant, savory palate delivers apricot, pineapple, Meyer lemon and white almond set against zesty acidity that leaves a dry, juicy finish. A saline note graces the close. KERIN O’KEEFE

Black-skinned berry, violet, new leather and tobacco aromas are front and center. Reflecting the nose, the smooth, approachable palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, ripe plum, nutmeg and a hint of licorice framed in polished, pliant tannins. Drink through 2024. KERIN O’KEEFE

Heady aromas of Spanish broom, white and yellow stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub along with a whiff of green melon fill the glass. Crisp, elegant and savory, the medium-bodied palate delivers ripe Bartlett pear, nectarine, Meyer lemon and tangy mineral notes. Enjoy now for the succulent fruit and freshness, or hold for more complexity. Drink through 2024. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Feudi di San Gregorio 2018 Cutizzi (Greco di Tufo)
column7: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Aromas of blueberry brandy, underbrush, dark spice and eucalyptus take shape in the glass. On the tightly knit, brawny palate, assertive, close-grained tannins support dried black cherry, licorice and clove alongside the heat of evident alcohol. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of black-skinned fruit, underbrush, dried herbs and French oak form the subtle nose. Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, the firm, medium-bodied palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, spiced prune, dried sage and mocha alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2026. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of underbrush and prune and a whiff of pressed rose come together in the glass along with a resin note. Concentrated and enveloping, the rounded, full-bodied palate offers dried cherry, raisin, licorice and tobacco, all framed in tightly knit, close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2030. KERIN O’KEEFE

Resin, black-skinned berries, exotic spices and baked plum aromas slowly take shape on this along with whiffs of French oak. Densely concentrated, the firm, muscular palate offers blackberry jam, prune, vanilla and coconut set against assertive, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2025. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of plum cake, orange and potpourri spice carry to the rounded, lush palate. There's density to the jammy fruit flavors, with immense acidity and copious yet pulverized tannins providing a fine counterbalance. While this leans more powerful than finessed, the overall outcome is quite enjoyable. This should reward with a few years in the cellar. Drink from 2022. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Tommasi 2013 Masseria Surani Dionysos Riserva (Primitivo di Manduria)
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: White spring flowers, Alpine herbs and orange zest mingle with a whiff of bread crust on this crisp sparkler. The linear, racy palate offers yellow apple, pear, Meyer lemon and thyme alongside firm acidity. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Nino Franco 2014 Grave di Stecca Glera (Vino Spumante)

column1: Aromas of grilled herbs, ripe yellow stone fruits, Spanish broom and lychee fill the glass. On the vibrant, linear palate, crisp acidity accompanies mature apricot, yellow peach, lemon zest and saline. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Villa Raiano 2016 Contrada Marotta (Greco di Tufo)
column7: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Aromas of spring wildflowers and tropical fruits are front and center. On the tangy, savory yet understated palate, crisp acidity accompanies pineapple, green melon and Meyer lemon while a saline note lingers on the finish. KERIN O’KEEFE
column7: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: A heady mix of tilled earth, anise and tar ride over a dense blackberry and plum jam core. While densely packed on the palate, there's an impressive line of acidity pushing through to draw out the jammy fruit and spice flavors. Firm tannins lend ample support and clench up the finish. Drink from 2023. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Tommasi 2015 Masseria Surani Dionysos Riserva (Primitivo di Manduria)
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: White spring flower and white orchard fruit aromas mingle with whiffs of beeswax on this fresh, polished white. The lovely palate shows ripe yellow apple, white peach and citrus zest before an almond and graphite finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of beeswax, acacia and honey mingle with whiffs of wild herb. The aromas carry on to the vibrant, focused palate along with mature yellow pear, citrus and saline before a bitter almond close. Drink through 2024. KERIN O’KEEFE

A blend of equal parts Viognier and Grechetto, this opens with aromas of acacia flower, white stone fruit and a hint of cedar. The savory palate offers Bartlett pear, white peach, toasted almond and a hint of ginger alongside bright acidity. Drink through 2023. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Alessandrojacopo Boncompagni Ludovisi 2016 Fiorano White (Vino Bianco d'Italia)
column7: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy

column1: Aromas of leather, underbrush, rose, dark spice and camphor lead the way. On the firm, focused palate, fine-grained tannins support cranberry, sour cherry and licorice before it closes on a coffee bean note. It's fresh, with bright acidity. Drink 2021–2028. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Val di Suga 2013 Riserva (Brunello di Montalcino)

column1: Honeysuckle and exotic fruit aromas are front and center on this dazzling white. On the linear, vibrant palate, you'll find honeydew, Meyer lemon and tart apple alongside crisp acidity. A mineral note reminiscent of oyster shell closes the dry, tangy finish. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Feudi di San Gregorio 2018 Greco di Tufo
column7: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Aromas of lemon and wild herbs with a whiff of smoke take shape on this linear, vibrant white. Reflecting the nose, the racy, elegant palate delivers tart apple, citrus and a saline-like citrus note before a nutty finish. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2018 Refiano (Fiano di Avellino)
column7: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Fruity and floral, this fresh, juicy red offers aromas of wild berries, fragrant blue flowers and crushed herbs with a whiff of forest floor. Showing Nebbiolo's playful, charming side, it's bright and delicious, doling out succulent Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, orange zest and baking spice alongside tangy acidity and supple tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young, so drink over the next few years. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Villa Guelpa 2017 Longitudine 8.26 Nebbiolo (Vino Rosso d'Italia)
column7: Vino Rosso d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy

column1: This opens with aromas of wild red berry, botanical herb, pipe tobacco and underbrush. The aromas follow over to the medium-bodied palate together with spiced blackberry, while fine-grained tannins offer polished support. KERIN O’KEEFE

Blackberry jam and exotic spice aromas lead the nose along with a hint of menthol. On the brawny, velvety palate, flavors of vanilla, licorice and mocha accent a core of fleshy black cherry and prune. The heat of evident alcohol signals the finish, while close-grained tannins offer firm support. Drink through 2026. KERIN O’KEEFE

From the winery's Salento estate located in the Brindisi province, this Negroamaro shows a wealth of black olive, game, pepper and brandied dark berries on the nose. The firm, medium-bodied palate is framed by polished tannins that prop up a complex mix of fruit, spice and savory qualities that echo the nose. A tangy mineral note propels freshness from the start to the lingering finish. Drink from 2022. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

Aromas of dark-skinned berries, toasted oak and underbrush lead the nose. The spicy, structured palate offers dried black cherry, black pepper, tobacco and clove alongside tight, close-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2029. KERIN O’KEEFE

Yellow wildflower, exotic fruit and ripe pear aromas lead the nose. On the juicy, savory palate, a tangy mineral note energizes creamy white peach, Meyer lemon and honeydew, while a hint of white almond lingers on the finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of citrus, honey and pressed Spanish broom shape the nose. Linear and savory, the palate also boasts elegance, offering mature apricot, yellow pear, lemon drop candy and tangy saline alongside fresh acidity. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Cantina di Monteforte 2016 Castellaro (Soave Classico Superiore)

column1: Extremely refined, this understated but intriguing wine offers delicate aromas of mature yellow stone fruit, citrus and hawthorn. Smooth and enveloping, the palate shows elegance and a weightless concentration, doling out mature apricot, lemon zest, mineral and white almond alongside mild but still fresh acidity. KERIN O’KEEFE

A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Colorino, this focused red opens with aromas of black cherry and blue flowers along with a whiff of exotic spice. Savory and medium bodied, the polished palate delivers cassis, white pepper and star anise set against polished tannins. Bright acidity keeps it fresh and focused. Drink now through 2023. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of steeped plum and baking spice and a whiff of rose lift out of the glass. Round and concentrated, the full-bodied, enveloping palate doles out fleshy black cherry, blackberry jam and cinnamon alongside close-grained, dusty tannins. Drink through 2026. KERIN O’KEEFE

Sourced from 50- to 90-year-old bush-trained vines, this dense red offers a wealth of baked plum, fig, cracked pepper and orange rind on the nose. The palate is rich yet well balanced by a framing of persistent acidity and firm tannins. Cocoa and coffee tones provide a solid counterpoint to all the ripe, jammy fruit. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Produttori di Manduria 2014 Sonetto Riserva (Primitivo di Manduria)
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: This wine spent 18 months in 50% new French oak. Aromas of anise, game and pepper ride over a concentrated dark cherry core on the nose. The palate is creamy in feel, with ripe berry and savory spice flavors that are supported by integrated tannins and bright acidity. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column7: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Aromas of cassis and blue flowers along with a whiff of bell pepper lift out of the glass. Savory and smooth, the juicy palate delivers black cherry, licorice, ground pepper and crushed mint. Firm, refined tannins provide the framework. KERIN O’KEEFE

This blend of Primitivo, Negroamaro and Cabernet Sauvignon offers an intense nose of brandied cherry and blackberry, with a wealth of peppery spice, anise and potpourri. It is full in feel, displaying a mix of dried and fresh fruit tones that meld with sweet spice and drying tannins. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

A wealth of savory spice starts off this wine: anise and Chinese five spice powder are joined by orange and game. The full-bodied palate is big and plush in feel, filled out by ripe dark cherry and blackberry flavors. Despite the massive feel, there's plenty of balance from tangy acidity and a lifted mineral element. The tannins offer grip but remain in check, providing ample support for all that fruit. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Poderi d'Agostino 2016 F.D. Nero di Troia (Murgia)

column1: This red offers an intense nose of tobacco, game, violet and peppery spice, with rich cherry filling out the core. Starting out rounded and plump on the medium-bodied palate, bright acidity and a tangy mineral note quickly pick up and lend a fine, taut feel alongside sinewy tannins. The finish lingers on savory spice tones. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Torrevento 2014 Ottagono Riserva Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)
column7: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Aromas of cedar, dried yellow stone fruits, Spanish broom and wild herbs come together on this. The full-bodied palate offers dried apricot, mature pear, lemon drop candy and toasted nut before a saline finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

This Primitivo-led rosato offers bright aromas of cherry, watermelon and cinnamon. It's vibrant and crunchy on the palate in lots of bubbly berry flavors that are energized by a slick of wet stone. Cranberry skin tannins frame it all, contributing to the overall power of this boisterous pink pour. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

Citrus blossom, white stone fruit and wild herb aromas set the tone on this elegant white. Linear and racy, the palate offers yellow apple, pear, Meyer lemon and tangy minerality evoking oyster shell alongside bright acidity. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Feudi di San Gregorio 2018 Fiano di Avellino
column7: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals aromas of pressed field flowers and wet stone. Tangy and linear, the rounded, understated palate evokes dried apricot, mature pear and a hint of lemon drop candy alongside a suggestion of saline on the close. KERIN O’KEEFE

Intensely fragrant, this soft, savory white opens with heady scents of elderflower, citrus blossom and white stone fruit. The palate doles out ripe Granny Smith, white peach, green melon and Meyer lemon alongside tangy acidity. It closes on the barest hint of white almond. KERIN O’KEEFE

This opens with aromas of exotic fruit and fragrant spring flowers. On the medium-bodied palate, crisp acidity accompanies Reinette apple, white peach, Meyer lemon and a hint of minerality before a tangy close. KERIN O’KEEFE

Lightly scented, this has delicate but enticing aromas of spring flowers and white stone fruit with a whiff of beeswax. The rounded palate offers yellow apple, nectarine, lemon zest and white almond alongside fresh acidity. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of baked cherry and blackberry meld with dried hay, anise and orange on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is all about jammy fruit, with accents of spice, orange and earth that add complexity. Bright acidity and drying tannins push through to tighten up the close. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Produttori di Manduria 2015 Elegia Riserva (Primitivo di Manduria)
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: This bright, crunchy Primitivo sees no time in oak. Firm black cherry and blackberry aromas are lifted by streaks of graphite and pink peppercorn. It is tangy yet explosive on the palate in a tart dark-berry flavor, with a grip of tannins providing a fine counterbalance. Graphite and violet pick up on the midpalate and extend through the finish. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column7: Gioia del Colle, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Dense dark-berry aromas are lifted by plenty of violet, graphite and potpourri spice on the nose. There's a creaminess to the dark fruit on the palate, with warm baking spice tones and firm tannins giving grip and bright acidity lifting it up. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

Enticing scents of spring blossoms, citrus, white stone fruit and Mediterranean brush waft out of the glass. Structured and loaded with finesse, the vibrant, linear palate delivers Meyer lemon, white peach, Bartlett pear and tangy saline notes before a long, crisp finish. Drink through 2024. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Terredora Di Paolo 2018 Le Loggia della Serra (Greco di Tufo)
column7: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: This elegant sparkler opens with delicate scents recalling violet, red berry, bread crust and citrus. The focused, racy palate offers pink grapefruit, pomegranate and a saline-like mineral note, while vibrant acidity lends nice tension. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Cascina Chicco 2015 Cuvée Rosé Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)
column5: Cuvée Rosé Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico

column1: Ripe black-skinned fruit, truffle, wild herb and brown spice aromas shape the nose. A blend of 70% Sangiovese, 15% Sagrantino and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, it's smooth and juicy, offering ripe black cherry, blackberry compote and nutmeg alongside taut, polished tannins. Enjoy through 2021. KERIN O’KEEFE

Alluring aromas of Spanish broom, white stone fruits and wild herbs shape the nose. The linear, focused palate offers Reinette apple, pear, Meyer lemon and saline before a hazelnut finish. Crisp acidity keeps it vibrant. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Terredora Di Paolo 2018 Fiano di Avellino
column7: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Aromas of white orchard fruit and Spanish broom with a whiff of honeydew take shape in the glass. On the focused, racy palate, bright acidity accompanies white peach, yellow pear, Meyer lemon and a hint of honeyed almond before a saline close. KERIN O’KEEFE
column7: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Honed aromas of grapefruit, melon, crushed herbs and peony carry the nose. There's a beautiful tension to the palate in tight mineral and grapefruit flavors that are broadened out by plenty of juicier melon and apricot tones. The savory, earthy tones win out on the finish, ending brisk and clean. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

The first vintage of this Negroamaro rosato comes out with a bang. Pretty aromas of grapefruit, melon and spice carry to the creamy, medium-bodied palate. Tangy acidity lends power and support to the fruit, with slight astringency offering a firm grip to the whole experience. An orange blossom tone lingers on the finish. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

A concentrated nose of brandied cherry, tobacco and dried herbs carries the nose. The medium-bodied palate is rich in feel yet well honed by persistent acidity and integrated tannins. Flavors of dark cherry, leather and tobacco are lifted by a bright mineral vein that extends through the lingering finish. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Leone de Castris 2015 Donna Lisa Riserva Red (Salice Salentino)

column1: Aromas of yellow stone fruit and toasted hazelnut lead the nose along with a whiff of acacia. On the round, savory palate, a honeyed almond note accents ripe apricot and pineapple before a saline close. Drink through 2020. KERIN O’KEEFE

Yellow stone fruit, orange blossom and Mediterranean scrub aromas form the delicate, enticing nose. Tangy and linear, the precise palate delivers ripe Reinete apple, pear, white pepper and citrus set against crisp acidity. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Feudi di San Gregorio 2018 Serrocielo (Falanghina del Sannio)
column7: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Cassis, exotic spice, blue flower and graphite aromas form the nose. The structured, elegant palate offers dried black cherry, white pepper and licorice, while firm, fine-grained tannins provide polished support. Drink through 2026. KERIN O’KEEFE

A pleasing depth of bramble berry jam melds with lifted tones of violet, pepper and tilled earth in this delightful Primitivo. There's richness to the fruit on the palate, but it all feels quite fresh and crunchy due to the bright acidity and firm tannins. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Made with organically farmed Fiano, this racy, bone-dry sparkler delivers aromas and flavors of bread crust, citrus and saline, along with a smoky note. Vibrant acidity and a lively perlage provide the framework before a nutty, mineral finish. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Casa di Baal NV Oro di Baal Metodo Classico Pas Dosé Fiano (Vino Spumante)
column5: Oro di Baal Metodo Classico Pas Dosé

column1: Heady aromas suggesting ripe apple, honeysuckle and tropical fruit almost jump out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the bright, medium-bodied palate offers ripe pear, honeydew and tangerine drop candy. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Fattoria La Rivolta 2018 Falanghina del Sannio
column7: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Linear and savory, this elegant, understated white has lovely scents of spring blossoms, wet stone and orchard fruit. It's racy and light bodied, delivering lemon, yellow apple and bitter almond alongside vibrant acidity. KERIN O’KEEFE

Spring field flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of lightly grilled herb waft out of the glass. The tangy palate doles out mature apricot, yellow peach and lemon drop candy before a savory, saline finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

A blend of 60% Primitivo and 40% Negroamaro, this wine offers an intensity of tobacco, leather and dried herbs on the nose, with blackberry coulis filling out the dense core. It is rich in dark-berry flavors on the palate, yet bright acidity and firm tannins provide a solid frame alongside a wealth of lingering spice tones. Drink through 2025. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

This blend of 70% Aglianico, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah offers a wealth of fruit on the nose in red cherry, bramble berry and currant aromas, with delicate warm spice tones lingering in the background. The lithe palate follows suit, framed by soft, chalky tannins and tangy acidity. It's a lively blend that will please many palates. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column7: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Aromas of lemon blossom, white stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub lead the way on this intriguing white. The dry, rounded palate delivers unsweetened lemon drop candy, fennel seed and nectarine before a saline, almost salty finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

Elegant and understated, this opens with delicate scents of mature orchard fruit, yellow spring flower and crushed botanical herbs. The smooth, enveloping palate offers dried apricot, mature yellow pear and unsweetened lemon drop candy alongside juicy acidity. It closes on a hint of bitter almond. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Corte Mainente 2017 Vigne del Tenda (Soave Classico)

column1: Aromas of wisteria, exotic fruit and citrus shape the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the round, juicy palate offers banana, lemon drop candy and white peach alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a white almond note. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aged in large French casks, this opens with aromas of dried fruit, vanilla and zesty candied citrus peel. The mature, medium-bodied palate offers lemon drop candy, ripe grapefruit and toasted almond. The dry finish closes on a hint of spice. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Sandro de Bruno 2015 Monte San Piero (Soave Superiore)

column1: Made entirely from Negroamaro, this riserva offers a striking balance between elegance and rusticity. Brandied cherry and blackberry aromas carry the nose alongside a savory hoisin sauce note. Tangy red fruit broadens out the medium-bodied palate, with a grip of tannins carrying it through to the dark cocoa-dusted finish. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Leone de Castris 2015 Per Lui Riserva Red (Salice Salentino)

column1: Aromas of mixed berry preserves and fig are lifted by accents of pepper, violet and tar on the nose. There's a pleasing vibrancy to the palate, with lively acidity brightening flavors of jammy berries and orange rind. The tannins are fine yet copious, giving a structured frame to this immensely food-friendly wine. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Vespa 2017 Il Rosso dei Vespa (Primitivo di Manduria)
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Lifted aromas of crushed red pepper, cracked black pepper and tar sit over a dense dark berry core on the nose. There's ample richness on the palate in lush dark berry flavors yet it's lifted by an equal force of bright acidity. This shows good progression and structure, offering a balance between power and precision. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

Dark cherry, bubblegum, anise and clove dot the nose of this brooding Primitivo. There's a creamy concentration of dark fruit to the palate, with tangy acidity lifting it up. Plenty of warm spice and dry tannins linger on the close. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

Made entirely with Malvasia, this offers scents of yellow stone fruits, citrus and yellow spring flowers. The palate is delicately sparkling and tangy, offering orange zest, pear and apricot before a hint of lemon drop candy. KERIN O’KEEFE
column3: Virgona NV Ruffiano Extra Dry Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

column1: Bright aromas of cherry jam, plum, geranium, blood orange rind and crushed stone carry the nose. The sleek, light-bodied palate offers crunchy red fruit lifted by juicy acidity, making this a superfresh and enjoyable wine. The tannins ride in the background, lending support to the fruit and mineral flavors. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

Earthy and enjoyable, this opens with aromas evoking wild black cherry, tilled soil, leather and a whiff of game. The aromas follow over to the bright, sleek palate along with crushed thyme and a hint of clove. KERIN O’KEEFE

This opens with aromas of spring blossoms, mature yellow stone fruits and wild herbs with whiffs of spice. Reflecting the nose, the medium-bodied, rounded palate delivers mature apricot, spearmint, white mint and yellow peach alongside lemon zest. It closes on a bitter almond note. KERIN O’KEEFE

Inky ruby in the glass, this rich wine offers aromas of cherry jam on the nose, alongside iodine, blood orange and a savory note reminiscent of sake. There's density to the lush fruit on the medium-bodied palate, supported by firm tannins and well-balanced acidity. A cocoa-dusted blueberry note lingers on the finish. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: Made with organically grown grapes and fermented in amphorae, this brawny red has a shy nose that eventually reveals stewed plum, moist earth and game. Densely concentrated, the ripe palate doles out blackberry jam, prune and baking spice alongside solid, enveloping tannins that leave a firm, drying finish. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol on the close. KERIN O’KEEFE

Bright, bouncy aromas of red cherry and blackberry carry a sweet spice inflection of vanilla and anise on the nose. This is light in profile yet smooth and supple in feel, with a delicate framing of polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink in the near term. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Leone de Castris 2016 50th Vintage Riserva Red (Salice Salentino)

column1: There's a wealth of ripeness to this rosato, displaying rich tones of crushed strawberry, cherry and watermelon alongside a slight balsamic tone. While it shows a depth of fruit on the palate, it still maintains admirable freshness in bright acidity. A resinous herb accent offers additional lift, and fine, stony tannins mark the close. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Produttori di Manduria 2018 Aka Primitivo Rosato (Salento)

column1: Aromas of elderflower, citrus and white orchard fruit lead the nose. The rounded palate shows body and discreet concentration, offering ripe yellow pear, peach and lemon drop candy before a bitter almond finish. KERIN O’KEEFE

Spiced plum and blue flower aromas take center stage on this blend of Sangiovese, Sagrantino, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. On the full-bodied palate, solid tannins accompany fleshy black cherry, cassis and ground pepper. Drink through 2022. KERIN O’KEEFE

Aromas of spiced blackberry and cherry meld with accents of smoke, stone and blood orange. The well-meshed palate is built by fine tannins and bright acidity, rounded out by plenty of lush berry flavors. This is smooth and supple in feel, with a well-balanced nature that makes it a great crowd-pleasing wine. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Tommasi 2016 Masseria Surani Heracles (Primitivo di Manduria)
column7: Primitivo di Manduria, Southern Italy, Italy

column1: This blend of Negroamaro and Malvasia Nera doesn't give much away on the nose at first, yet iodine, baked black fruit and dark chocolate arise with time in the glass. There's a brawniness to the medium-bodied palate in the way of rich flavors of mixed berry jam, cocoa and vanilla that extend on the finish. Medium-grained tannins and juicy acidity lend ample support to the whole. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

This blend of Primitivo, Aglianico, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon offers a well-integrated nose of leather, anise and brandy-soaked cherries. The smooth palate offers rich cherry and berry flavors that are brightened by specks of savory spice and earth. Supple tannins and fresh acidity frame it all. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Amastuola 2016 Onda del Tempo Organic Red (Puglia)

column1: Ripe cherry and blackberry aromas are lifted by orange and potpourri spices. Rounded in feel, the palate pops in bright, bouncy red-fruit flavors, with spicy tannins riding underneath. Accents of violet and graphite arise on the midpalate and extend through the finish. ALEXANDER PEARTREE

This light ballerina pink rosato offers bright aromas of peaches and cream, cherry blossom and grapefruit. An orange creamsicle flavor arises on the palate, yet there's tamed acidity and delicate tannins to tighten it up. ALEXANDER PEARTREE
column3: Masseria Li Veli 2018 Primerose Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)
